content: @WG-prioritization we have our steering meeting in ~ 1h 38m
@WG-prioritization :wave:, please react with :wave: to show who is participating
so let's get this meeting started ...
unsure if you guys have something specific to talk about or should we go around and check the issue tracker https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team-prioritization/issues ?
I guess silence means nothing specific to talk about
(yeah nothing to discuss about issues on my end at this time)
so earlier I was thinking a bit about this meeting in general and what this specific instance of it was gonna be about
and for this specific one to be honest I'm not sure :)
I think we've created this meeting at the point the working group was being formed and in this meeting we've used the time to organize a lot of things in great ways
but right now in my opinion this meeting is starting to lose meaning
unsure what others think
I think that we can have discussions about issue tracker async
issues are there and most are free to be picked up but most of our process is working great in my opinion
we've just some things to polish

What's the purpose of a meeting for a triage group where you have nothing much to discuss ...

Feels familiar already :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:
Maybe we could move it to once a month meeting?
right, it was useful but this is the first meeting there's nothing really important to discuss in my opinion
and my feeling is that things are settling
so I wouldn't even move to once a month, I'd just cancel and have discussions async
we can always schedule meetings on demand, but scheduling something that is recurring will have the same issues
... and perhaps revive it if there is some "meat" to discuss sync :top:
I'd rather use these 30 minutes to fix some stuff from the issue tracker :smile:

Hmm, I think it might still be nice to have some kind of "hey, this is something relevant I am working on", but afaict we are already doing this by just pinging the wg on github, so we don't really need a meeting for that
@lcnr right and there's always the possibility of opening a Zulip topic and ping everyone
so ... I'm going to cancel the meeting and remove the event from the calendar
and if there's nothing else to discuss, let's close this one
any updates on the toolstate discussion (whether we should continue doing it or not)
as always if people want to pick up something from the issue tracker I won't be offended and I'll offer help of course :heart:

DPC said:

any updates on the toolstate discussion (whether we should continue doing it or not)

right, let me check
simulacrum told me ...
actually let me open an issue maybe ...
but we could automate some stuff there and call it a day
do we know who are/is the person(s) interested to that info? did you receive any feedback ?
well i update the rustfmt, rustrls or miri (normally ralf) about breakage, and they go about checking if there's a pr or not and tell me if there is a pr or go about fixing it during the week
https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team-prioritization/issues/11
to be honest I'm not really sure about how certain thing in that issue can be accomplished
cc @simulacrum (I've also pinged you in the issue)
